subject: Math
title: Introduction to Linear Equations
description: Understanding the basics of linear equations and how to solve them

content.text: Linear equations are equations where the highest power of the variable is 1. They form straight lines when graphed.

content.heading: Standard Form
content.text: A linear equation can be written as: ax + b = c, where a, b, and c are constants and x is the variable.

content.heading: Example 1
solution: Step 2: Divide both sides by 2: x = 4
